##  Pull Request 

Thank you for contributing to **Anti-YouTube-Shorts**! Before submitting your pull request, please ensure you have read the [CONTRIBUTING.md](CONTRIBUTING.md) guide.

### ğŸ“ Type of Change

Please mark with an `[x]` the type of change your PR introduces.

- [ ] ğŸ› **Bug Fix** (A filter fix that resolves an issue reported in the Issue Tracker)
- [ ] âœ¨ **Enhancement/New Feature** (A new filter or logic improvement, usually stemming from a Discussion)
- [ ] ğŸ“š **Documentation** (Changes to README, Contributing guides, etc.)
- [ ] ğŸ§¹ **Cleanup** (Removing obsolete filters, refactoring filter organization)

### ğŸ”— Related Issues/Discussions

Please link the relevant GitHub Issue or Discussion that this PR addresses.

* **Issue Number:** #... (e.g., `#42`)
* **Discussion Link:** (e.g., `https://github.com/rekoy-dev/Anti-YouTube-Shorts/discussions/...`)

---

### ğŸ” Details of Change

#### **1. Description**

A clear and concise summary of the changes made. Why was this change necessary?

*(Example: Added a new `##.yt-shorts-feed` selector to block Shorts carousels appearing on the subscription page sidebar.)*

#### **2. How was this change tested?**

Describe the steps you took to ensure your filter works as intended without breaking the core YouTube UI.

* [ ] Tested the new filter on the targeted page/element.
* [ ] Confirmed the primary YouTube UI elements (Sidebar, Home Feed, Watch Page) remain functional.
* [ ] Confirmed the filter does not cause excessive performance impact or flashing.

#### **3. Relevant URLs (If Applicable)**

If your filter targets a specific part of YouTube, please list the URL where the change can be verified.

*(e.g., `https://www.youtube.com/feed/subscriptions`)*

### âœ… Checklist

Please confirm that you have completed the following checks:

- [x] I have read and agree to the [CONTRIBUTING.md](CONTRIBUTING.md) guide.
- [x] My changes are applied only to the `filter.txt` file (for filter changes).
- [x] My commit messages are clear and follow a consistent format (e.g., `FIX: Blocked new selector on home feed`).
- [x] This PR is ready for review.
